#Text=' No treaty withdrawal ' , says Lakota elder
#Text=Saturday , January 12 , 2008
#Text=File : Lakota Freedom Delegation conference 1 . jpg
#Text=The Lakota Freedom Delegation announcing their withdrawal on December 19 .
#Text=Image : Naomi Archer . ( Image missing from commons : image ; log )

#Text=The Lakota Freedom Delegation , which in December declared that the Lakota people were withdrawing from their treaties with the United States and reasserting their sovereignty as an independent state , is acting without the support of the Treaty Council , the traditional government of the Lakota , Wikinews has learned .
#Text=Wikinews

#Text=spoke with Floyd Looks-For-Buffalo Hand , an Oglala Lakota Treaty Delegate and Elder , also an author and a spiritual leader in the indigenous Lakota religion , and who is also blood uncle to Lakota Freedom Delegation member Canupa Gluha Mani .

#Text=The Lakota Freedom Delegation has claimed that , while the BIA -recognized tribal governments of the Lakota have not supported them , the Lakota Freedom Delegation 's authority extends from support by the Treaty Council of the Elders of Lakota as well as from the 1974 International Indian Treaty Council .
#Text="

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= Russell Means and Duane Martin [ Canupa Gluha Mani ] and that lady [ Phyllis Young ] , they do not speak for the nation .

#Text=Hand furthermore called the treaty withdrawal event a  publicity stunt " and that furthermore the 1974 meeting was not authorization to act on behalf of the Lakota people .

column1: #Text=While Means , Canupa Gluha Mani , and the rest of the delegation " have free speech " and can do as they wish , he said , the Elders of Lakota " stated that they should remove themselves from treaty territory , " that is , the Reservations inhabited by the Lakota .
#Text=But " they 're still living here " ( Canupa Gluha Mani has been residing in Asheville , North Carolina since the treaty withdrawal press conference on December 19 ) .
#Text=When asked if the above decisions represented the consensus of the whole Treaty Council , Hand stated , " we all do the same because we 're all fullbloods .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Hand went on to explain , though , that the Treaty Council was planning to reconsider the Lakota 's arrangement with the United States government .

#Text=The Treaty Council of all eight Lakota tribes , which will meet on 28 – 30 January 2008 , will consider whether to  sit down to negotiate " with the federal government .

column1: #Text=Members of the Lakota Freedom Delegation are expected to take part in that meeting .

#Text=European-Americans , Hand said , are " not honoring " the 1851 and 1868 treaties which connected the Lakota to the United States , and noted that the Lakota were the only people to " conquer " the United States during the Indian Wars of the 19th century .
#Text=The arrangement with the United States , which he called a " contract " , " handcuffs us through the federal programs " .
#Text=On their own , Hand said , " if we rely on a sovereign nation as a nation , relating to other nations with our economic development I think we can survive .

#Text= We can be well off , " he argued .

column1: #Text=In another contradiction of the Lakota Freedom Delegation 's program , Hand said that the Treaty Delegations " do n't want technology on our reservation " .
#Text=One of his concerns was environmentalism .

#Text=People of European descent are " taking too much out of Mother Earth " , he said , making reference to ongoing environmental effects of uranium mining which has long been a contentious issue on the Lakota reservations .
#Text=The Treaty Delegation 's goal , he said , is " preserving the land and animals and letting the water remain free .
